block.p: Rebecca Nylen Eisele, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Paul M. Eisele of San Francisco, was married yesterday evening on Fire Island to Gregory Patrick Luib, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Manfred Luib of Chagrin Falls, Ohio. Bishop John Shelby Spong, who is retired from the Episcopal Archdiocese of Newark, performed the ceremony at the Church at Point O'Woods.

Mrs. Luib, 28, graduated from Middlebury College and received an M.B.A. degree in May from New York University. Her father is the chief operating officer at GenED Inc., an Internet company based in San Francisco that provides life-science education. Her mother, Karin F. Eisele, works in San Francisco as the executive director for the West Coast region of the Institute of International Education.

Rebecca Nylen Eisele, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Paul M. Eisele of San Francisco, was married yesterday evening on Fire Island to Gregory Patrick Luib, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Manfred Luib of Chagrin Falls, Ohio. Bishop John Shelby Spong, who is retired from the Episcopal Archdiocese of Newark, performed the ceremony at the Church at Point O'Woods.

Mrs. Luib, 28, graduated from Middlebury College and received an M.B.A. degree in May from New York University. Her father is the chief operating officer at GenED Inc., an Internet company based in San Francisco that provides life-science education. Her mother, Karin F. Eisele, works in San Francisco as the executive director for the West Coast region of the Institute of International Education.

Mr. Luib, also 28, is an associate at the Washington office of Jones, Day, Reavis & Pogue, the Cleveland law firm. He received bachelor's and law degrees from the University of Virginia. His mother, Maureen L. Luib, is a registered nurse at Hillcrest Hospital in Mayfield Heights, Ohio. His father is a manager of business development at Rockwell Automation, a systems and components manufacturer in Cleveland.
